'''Jerome Flynn''' (born 16 March 1963) is an English actor. He is best known for his role as Paddy Garvey in five seasons of the popular drama series ''[[wikipedia:Soldier, Soldier|Soldier, Soldier]]''. While filming this series he and co-star [[wikipedia:Robson Green|Robson Green]] filmed a scene where they had to sing the song ''[[wikipedia:Unchained Melody|Unchained Melody]]''. Impressed, record producer [[wikipedia:Simon Cowell|Simon Cowell]] convinced them to release the song commercially. They went on to enjoy a period of musical success as [[wikipedia:Robson and Jerome|Robson and Jerome]] between 1995 and 1999. Following this Flynn went to play in musicals and on stage.

In ''[[Game of Thrones]]'' Flynn plays the role of [[Bronn]]. He was confirmed in the role on 16 July 2010. He initially appeared as a guest star in the [[Season 1|first season]] and joined the starring cast for the [[Season 2|second season]].

Flynn auditioned for the part while he had a black eye, left over from when he knocked himself in his brother's kitchen the day before. He insists that this gave him a rough look which got him the part. Flynn auditioned for Bronn while affecting a Scottish accent, but the producers decided that he should speak with a jaunty Northern English accent.<ref>[http://www.vulture.com/2013/10/game-of-thrones-bronn-jerome-flynn-comic-con.html Vulture.com], NYCC 2013 panel</ref>
